Constructor Detail

NetworkModel

public NetworkModel()
This constructor creates a NetworkModel object with current time tomorrow as the end date. This constructor should not be used.

NetworkModel

public NetworkModel(java.lang.String endDate)
This constructor creates a NetworkModel object with the specified end date.

Parameters:
endDate - Specifies the endDate in the ScaledTimeGMT class
Method Detail

getReport

public java.lang.String[] getReport(java.lang.String[] dnList,
                                    javax.oss.pm.measurement.PerformanceAttributeDescriptor[] attributesToMeasure,
                                    int granularityPeriod,
                                    java.util.Date argStartOfGranPeriod)
getReport will create a performance report for a set of observable objects.

Parameters:
dnList - The distinguished names of the objects that should be in the report.
granularityPeriod - The granularity period of the report in seconds.
argStartOfGranPeriod - The start of the measurement period.
Returns:
A performance report encoded in XML according to 3GPP TS32.401.

getSupportedObservableObjects

public java.lang.String[] getSupportedObservableObjects(java.lang.String[] dnList)
getSupportedObservableObjects will filter out which of the potentially observable objects are actually observable.

Parameters:
dnList -
Returns:
strSupported

getSupportedGranularities will return an array of granularities that is supported by the supplied observable object class.

Returns:
An array of granularities that is supported by the supplied observable object class.

getObservableObjectClasses

public javax.oss.pm.util.ObservableObjectClassIterator getObservableObjectClasses()
getObservableObjectClasses will return all observable object classes in the model.

Returns:
An array of granularities that is supported by the supplied observable object class.

getObservableObjects

public javax.oss.pm.util.ObservableObjectIterator getObservableObjects(java.lang.String observableObjectClassName,
                                                                       java.lang.String base)
                                                                throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                       java.rmi.RemoteException
getObservableObjects will return all observable objects of a certain class under a level determined by the base. If base is not specified then all instances of that class are returned.

Parameters:
observableObjectClassName - The class name of the observable object instances to be found.
base - The distinguished name of the level where the search should start from.
Returns:
Iterator that contains all supported observable objects.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - Is raised when a unexpected system exception occurs.
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised if the input paramters are not valid.

getObservableAttributes

public javax.oss.pm.measurement.PerformanceAttributeDescriptor[] getObservableAttributes(java.lang.String observableObjectClassName)
                                                                                  throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException
getObservableAttributes will return all observable attributes for a certain class.

Parameters:
observableObjectClassName - The class name of the observable object instances to be found.
Returns:
An array of attribute descriptors.
Throws:
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised if the input paramters are not valid.

loadData

public void loadData(java.lang.String dataDir)
loadData will load all performance data for the objects in the network model. Everything is cached in memory.

Parameters:
dataDir - The directory where to get the performance data files.
Throws:
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised if the input paramters are not valid.
